messages.content: Quiero extraer el zip para el repositorio

Perfecto ‚Äî puedo ayudarte. Antes de hacer nada, necesito saber una cosa r√°pida:

- ¬øEl archivo .zip est√° en tu m√°quina, en un servidor, o ya est√° subido al repo en la ruta upload/?
- ¬øQuieres que te d√© los pasos para hacerlo t√∫ mismo localmente, o quieres que yo lo extraiga y lo suba al repositorio por ti? (Si quieres que lo haga yo, adjunta el .zip o dame la URL y confirma que el repositorio es pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS y si deseas crear una rama/PR o commitear directamente en main.)

Mientras confirmas, aqu√≠ tienes instrucciones claras (pasos y comandos) para extraer el zip localmente y subir los cambios al repo ‚Äî cubro Linux/macOS (bash) y Windows (PowerShell), y algunas notas sobre l√≠mites y buenas pr√°cticas.

Pasos resumidos
- Clona el repo.
- Crea una rama nueva.
- Descomprime el .zip en la carpeta deseada (ej. upload/).
- Revisa .gitignore y el tama√±o de archivos (GitHub tiene l√≠mite ~100 MB por archivo; usa Git LFS si hace falta).
- A√±ade, commitea y push.
- Abre PR si lo deseas.

Comandos (Linux / macOS)
```bash name=extract-zip.sh
# 1) Clona el repo y crea una rama
git clone git@github.com:pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS.git
cd PULSE_DEV_OS
git checkout -b extract-zip-$(date +%F)

# 2) Descomprime el zip en la carpeta upload/ (ajusta /ruta/a/archivo.zip)
unzip -o /ruta/a/archivo.zip -d upload/

# 3) Revisa cambios, a√±ade, commitea y push
git status
git add upload/
git commit -m "Extract archive.zip into upload/"
git push -u origin HEAD
```

Comandos (Windows PowerShell)
```powershell name=extract-zip.ps1
# 1) Clona el repo y crea una rama
git clone https://github.com/pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS.git
Set-Location PULSE_DEV_OS
git checkout -b extract-zip-$(Get-Date -Format yyyy-MM-dd)

# 2) Descomprime el zip en la carpeta upload/ (ajusta C:\ruta\archivo.zip)
Expand-Archive -Path "C:\ruta\archivo.zip" -DestinationPath .\upload\ -Force

# 3) Revisa cambios, a√±ade, commitea y push
git status
git add upload/
git commit -m "Extract archive.zip into upload/"
git push -u origin HEAD
```

Notas importantes
- Si el .zip contiene archivos >100 MB, el push fallar√°. Usa Git LFS para archivos grandes o sube esos artefactos a un storage externo.
- GitHub no permite descomprimir archivos "en servidor": siempre hay que descomprimir localmente o en un runner y luego subir los archivos descomprimidos al repo.
- Revisa .gitignore antes de a√±adir (para evitar subir node_modules, builds, archivos temporales).
- Si quieres conservar el .zip en el repo adem√°s del contenido, a√±√°delo solo si es peque√±o; normalmente no conviene guardar zips grandes en git.

Si quieres que lo haga yo
- Confirma que el repo es pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS.
- Indica si deseas crear una rama + PR o commitear en main.
- Adjunta el .zip aqu√≠ o proporciona una URL p√∫blica desde donde pueda descargarlo.
- Confirma que tengo permiso para operar: ¬øprocedo a extraer y crear la rama/PR?

Dime c√≥mo prefieres proceder y lo hago.

# Repository Code Search Guide

This ability provides comprehensive guidance for searching and navigating code in GitHub repositories. You have two powerful search tools available: **semantic-code-search** and **lexical-code-search**. Understanding when and how to use each is critical for effective code exploration.

## Available Search Tools

### semantic-code-search
**What it does:** Understands the meaning and context of your query to find conceptually relevant code.

**When to use:**
- User asks conceptual questions: "How does X work?", "Where is Y implemented?"
- Exploring unfamiliar codebases to understand architecture or features
- Finding code related to a specific functionality or concept
- No specific symbol names or file paths are known
- Need to understand patterns or approaches used in the codebase

**Key characteristics:**
- Query MUST be a complete sentence describing what you're looking for
- Returns code snippets ranked by semantic relevance
- Repository-scoped only (one repo at a time)

**Examples:**
| User question | Tool call |
|--------------|-----------|
| "How does authentication work in owner/repo?" | semantic-code-search: query="How does authentication work?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |
| "Where is rate limiting implemented?" | semantic-code-search: query="Where is rate limiting implemented?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |
| "How are database errors handled?" | semantic-code-search: query="How are database connection errors handled?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |

### lexical-code-search
**What it does:** Performs exact pattern matching using qualifiers to find specific code elements.

**When to use:**
- User mentions specific symbols, functions, or class names
- Looking for EXACT text matches (error messages, specific strings)
- Need to find files by path or name patterns
- Searching across multiple repositories or organizations
- User provides EXACT code snippets to find
- Following up on semantic search to find exact definitions

**Key qualifiers:**
| Qualifier | Purpose | Example |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| symbol: | Find function/class/method definitions | symbol:AuthService |
| content: | Match exact text in files | content:"error code 500" |
| path: | Match file paths (use regex) | path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/ |
| repo: | Scope to specific repository | repo:owner/name |
| org: | Scope to organization | org:github |
| language: | Filter by programming language | language:python |
| is: | Filter by properties | is:archived, is:fork, is:vendored, is:generated |

**Symbol construction:**

Use symbol: when users ask about function, class, or method definitions.

Common patterns:
| User asks | Interpretation | Tool call |
|-----------|----------------|-----------|
| "Where is class Helper defined in monalisa/net?" | Looking for class definition | query="symbol:Helper", scopingQuery="repo:monalisa/net" |
| "What functions are in Foo.go?" | Looking for symbols in file | query="symbol:Foo" |
| "Describe the method MyFunc" | Looking for method definition | query="symbol:MyFunc" |
| "Find AuthService class" | Looking for class definition | query="symbol:AuthService" |
| "Where is authenticate function?" | Looking for function definition | query="symbol:authenticate" |

**Boolean operators:** Use OR, NOT, AND to combine conditions
- Example: symbol:authenticate NOT is:archived

**Parameters:**
- query: The search query with qualifiers
- scopingQuery: (optional) Additional scoping like repo:, org:, path:, language:

**Constructing path queries:**

When users ask for files in specific directories or with certain names, construct regex paths.

Common patterns:
- Any file with "helper" anywhere: path:/.*helper[^\\/]*$/
- Specific directory, any file: path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*$/
- File with extension: path:/.*\\.test\\.js$/

**Examples:**
| User question | Tool call |
|--------------|-----------|
| "Find the PaymentService class definition" | lexical-code-search: query="symbol:PaymentService" |
| "Show me all files with 'helper' in src/utils/" | lexical-code-search: query="path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/" |
| "Find error message 'connection timeout'" | lexical-code-search: query="content:\"connection timeout\"" |
| "Where is authenticate function in owner/repo?" | lexical-code-search: query="symbol:authenticate", scopingQuery="repo:owner/repo" |

## Example Workflows

### Example 1: Understanding a Feature
User: "How does payment processing work in owner/myapp?"

1. semantic-code-search: query="How does payment processing work?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="myapp"
   ‚Üí Discovers: PaymentService, StripeClient, processPayment function
2. lexical-code-search: query="symbol:PaymentService", scopingQuery="repo:owner/myapp"
   ‚Üí Finds exact class definition location
3. Read the file to understand implementation details

### Example 2: Finding Specific Code
User: "Where is the authenticate function defined?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="symbol:authenticate"
   ‚Üí Finds exact definition immediately

### Example 3: Debugging from Error Message
User: "I'm seeing 'database connection timeout' error, where does this come from?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="content:\"database connection timeout\""
   ‚Üí Finds where error message is defined
2. Read surrounding code for context

### Example 4: Exploring a Directory
User: "What helper utilities are in src/utils?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/"
   ‚Üí Lists all files with "helper" in that directory

## Remember

- **semantic-code-search** = Understanding concepts and architecture (requires full sentences, repoOwner, repoName)
- **lexical-code-search** = Finding exact symbols, patterns, and text (use qualifiers: symbol:, content:, path:)
- Use them together: semantic for exploration, lexical for precision

Los clusters:

- Prioriza outputs con mayor peso

### FAST vs DEEP MODE

FAST:
- Menos agentes
- M√°xima velocidad
- S√≠ntesis agresiva

DEEP:
- M√°s agentes
- Mayor contraste
- S√≠ntesis conservadora

## SNAPSHOT

Toda ejecuci√≥n relevante:
- guarda snapshot
- mantiene continuidad
- permite reanudar estado

## COMANDOS SOPORTADOS

## OUTPUT OBLIGATORIO

# Repository Code Search Guide

This ability provides comprehensive guidance for searching and navigating code in GitHub repositories. You have two powerful search tools available: **semantic-code-search** and **lexical-code-search**. Understanding when and how to use each is critical for effective code exploration.

## Available Search Tools

### semantic-code-search
**What it does:** Understands the meaning and context of your query to find conceptually relevant code.

**When to use:**
- User asks conceptual questions: "How does X work?", "Where is Y implemented?"
- Exploring unfamiliar codebases to understand architecture or features
- Finding code related to a specific functionality or concept
- No specific symbol names or file paths are known
- Need to understand patterns or approaches used in the codebase

**Key characteristics:**
- Query MUST be a complete sentence describing what you're looking for
- Returns code snippets ranked by semantic relevance
- Repository-scoped only (one repo at a time)

**Examples:**
| User question | Tool call |
|--------------|-----------|
| "How does authentication work in owner/repo?" | semantic-code-search: query="How does authentication work?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |
| "Where is rate limiting implemented?" | semantic-code-search: query="Where is rate limiting implemented?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |
| "How are database errors handled?" | semantic-code-search: query="How are database connection errors handled?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |

### lexical-code-search
**What it does:** Performs exact pattern matching using qualifiers to find specific code elements.

**When to use:**
- User mentions specific symbols, functions, or class names
- Looking for EXACT text matches (error messages, specific strings)
- Need to find files by path or name patterns
- Searching across multiple repositories or organizations
- User provides EXACT code snippets to find
- Following up on semantic search to find exact definitions

**Key qualifiers:**
| Qualifier | Purpose | Example |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| symbol: | Find function/class/method definitions | symbol:AuthService |
| content: | Match exact text in files | content:"error code 500" |
| path: | Match file paths (use regex) | path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/ |
| repo: | Scope to specific repository | repo:owner/name |
| org: | Scope to organization | org:github |
| language: | Filter by programming language | language:python |
| is: | Filter by properties | is:archived, is:fork, is:vendored, is:generated |

**Symbol construction:**

Use symbol: when users ask about function, class, or method definitions.

Common patterns:
| User asks | Interpretation | Tool call |
|-----------|----------------|-----------|
| "Where is class Helper defined in monalisa/net?" | Looking for class definition | query="symbol:Helper", scopingQuery="repo:monalisa/net" |
| "What functions are in Foo.go?" | Looking for symbols in file | query="symbol:Foo" |
| "Describe the method MyFunc" | Looking for method definition | query="symbol:MyFunc" |
| "Find AuthService class" | Looking for class definition | query="symbol:AuthService" |
| "Where is authenticate function?" | Looking for function definition | query="symbol:authenticate" |

**Boolean operators:** Use OR, NOT, AND to combine conditions
- Example: symbol:authenticate NOT is:archived

**Parameters:**
- query: The search query with qualifiers
- scopingQuery: (optional) Additional scoping like repo:, org:, path:, language:

**Constructing path queries:**

When users ask for files in specific directories or with certain names, construct regex paths.

Common patterns:
- Any file with "helper" anywhere: path:/.*helper[^\\/]*$/
- Specific directory, any file: path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*$/
- File with extension: path:/.*\\.test\\.js$/

**Examples:**
| User question | Tool call |
|--------------|-----------|
| "Find the PaymentService class definition" | lexical-code-search: query="symbol:PaymentService" |
| "Show me all files with 'helper' in src/utils/" | lexical-code-search: query="path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/" |
| "Find error message 'connection timeout'" | lexical-code-search: query="content:\"connection timeout\"" |
| "Where is authenticate function in owner/repo?" | lexical-code-search: query="symbol:authenticate", scopingQuery="repo:owner/repo" |

## Example Workflows

### Example 1: Understanding a Feature
User: "How does payment processing work in owner/myapp?"

1. semantic-code-search: query="How does payment processing work?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="myapp"
   ‚Üí Discovers: PaymentService, StripeClient, processPayment function
2. lexical-code-search: query="symbol:PaymentService", scopingQuery="repo:owner/myapp"
   ‚Üí Finds exact class definition location
3. Read the file to understand implementation details

### Example 2: Finding Specific Code
User: "Where is the authenticate function defined?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="symbol:authenticate"
   ‚Üí Finds exact definition immediately

### Example 3: Debugging from Error Message
User: "I'm seeing 'database connection timeout' error, where does this come from?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="content:\"database connection timeout\""
   ‚Üí Finds where error message is defined
2. Read surrounding code for context

### Example 4: Exploring a Directory
User: "What helper utilities are in src/utils?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/"
   ‚Üí Lists all files with "helper" in that directory

## Remember

- **semantic-code-search** = Understanding concepts and architecture (requires full sentences, repoOwner, repoName)
- **lexical-code-search** = Finding exact symbols, patterns, and text (use qualifiers: symbol:, content:, path:)
- Use them together: semantic for exploration, lexical for precision

messages.content: https://github.com/pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS/

He intentado acceder y ya cargu√© la habilidad de repository-code-search, pero desde mi entorno a√∫n no puedo leer/escribir directamente en tu repo aunque ahora lo hayas hecho p√∫blico. No puedo ejecutar el push/PR por ti desde aqu√≠.  

Puedo, en cambio, darte dos soluciones operativas inmediatas que te permiten obtener el mismo resultado (extraer el .zip en el repo y abrir PR) con un m√≠nimo de intervenci√≥n:

Opci√≥n A ‚Äî Ejecutarlo en tu m√°quina (m√°s r√°pido, control total)
- Clonar el repo, crear rama, descomprimir el ZIP en upload/, revisar >100MB, commit y push.  
- Comandos y script listos que puedes copiar/pegar.

Opci√≥n B ‚Äî Automatizarlo en el propio repo con GitHub Actions (yo preparo el workflow; t√∫ lo agregas y lo ejecutas)
- A√±ades el workflow que descarga el ZIP desde la rama principal (raw URL), extrae su contenido en upload/, detecta archivos grandes y hace commit en una rama nueva; luego puedes abrir PR desde la interfaz o usando gh CLI.
- Ideal si no quieres ejecutar nada localmente.

Elige A o B. Abajo tienes ambas opciones completas: scripts, pasos y notas.

1) Opci√≥n A ‚Äî Script local (Linux/macOS)
- Suposiciones por defecto:
  - ZIP en upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip en la rama main.
  - Extraer en upload/
  - Crear rama extract-zip-2026-02-05 y abrir PR (te doy comando gh pr create).

Archivo: extract-zip.sh
```bash name=extract-zip.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

REPO_SSH="git@github.com:pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS.git"
BRANCH="extract-zip-$(date +%F)"
ZIP_PATH="upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip"
DEST_DIR="upload"
GIT_COMMIT_MSG="Extract ${ZIP_PATH} into ${DEST_DIR}/"

# 1) Clona (si ya tienes el repo, salta esta parte y cd dentro)
if [ ! -d "PULSE_DEV_OS" ]; then
  git clone "${REPO_SSH}"
fi
cd PULSE_DEV_OS

# 2) Crea rama
git fetch origin
git checkout -b "${BRANCH}"

# 3) Asegurarse de que ZIP existe
if [ ! -f "${ZIP_PATH}" ]; then
  echo "ERROR: ${ZIP_PATH} not found. Adjust ZIP_PATH or ensure file exists in repo."
  exit 1
fi

# 4) Extraer en destino
mkdir -p "${DEST_DIR}"
unzip -o "${ZIP_PATH}" -d "${DEST_DIR}/"

# 5) Detectar archivos grandes (>100MB)
echo "Detectando archivos >100MB..."
LARGE_FILES=$(find "${DEST_DIR}" -type f -size +100M -print || true)
if [ -n "${LARGE_FILES}" ]; then
  echo "Archivos >100MB detectados:"
  echo "${LARGE_FILES}"
  echo "Si deseas usar Git LFS, instala y trackea antes de git add:"
  echo "  git lfs install"
  echo "  git lfs track \"*.ext\"   # ajustar patrones"
  echo "Revisar manualmente antes de continuar."
  # No abortamos autom√°ticamente, lo dejamos para revisi√≥n
fi

# 6) Preparar commit
git add "${DEST_DIR}"
git commit -m "${GIT_COMMIT_MSG}" || echo "No changes to commit."

# 7) Push y crear PR (usa gh CLI para crear PR)
git push -u origin "${BRANCH}"

echo "Branch pushed: ${BRANCH}"
echo "Crear PR con:"
echo "  gh pr create --base main --head ${BRANCH} --title \"${GIT_COMMIT_MSG}\" --body \"Extracted ZIP into ${DEST_DIR}/\""
```

C√≥mo usarlo (Linux/macOS):
- Guarda el script, hazlo ejecutable:
  - chmod +x extract-zip.sh
  - ./extract-zip.sh
- Si no tienes gh CLI o prefieres la UI, ve a GitHub y abre PR desde la rama creada.

Windows PowerShell (equivalente)
- Usa Expand-Archive y los mismos pasos: clona, checkout -b, Expand-Archive -Path .\upload\archivo.zip -DestinationPath .\upload\ -Force, git add/commit/push.

2) Opci√≥n B ‚Äî GitHub Actions workflow (ejecutar dentro del repo)
- Esto te permite que la extracci√≥n se haga "en el servidor" sin intervenci√≥n local. A√±ade el siguiente archivo a .github/workflows/extract-zip.yml en la rama main; luego act√≠valo manualmente desde la pesta√±a Actions (Run workflow) o mediante push a main.

Archivo: .github/workflows/extract-zip.yml
```yaml name=.github/workflows/extract-zip.yml
name: Extract ZIP and commit contents

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      zip_path:
        description: 'Path to ZIP in the repo (relative)'
        required: true
        default: 'upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip'
      dest_dir:
        description: 'Destination directory'
        required: true
        default: 'upload'
      branch_name:
        description: 'Branch to create for the extraction'
        required: true
        default: 'extract-zip-${{ github.event.client_payload.date }}'

jobs:
  extract-and-commit:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up variables
        run: |
          echo "ZIP_PATH=${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "DEST_DIR=${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          # branch param fallback
          if [ -z "${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}" ]; then
            echo "BRANCH_NAME=extract-zip-$(date +%F)" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          else
            BRANCH_NAME="${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
            # allow substituting date token
            BRANCH_NAME="${BRANCH_NAME//\$\{GITHUB_EVENT\}/}"
            echo "BRANCH_NAME=${BRANCH_NAME}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          fi
          echo "BRANCH_NAME=${BRANCH_NAME}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Ensure zip exists
        run: |
          if [ ! -f "${ZIP_PATH}" ]; then
            echo "::error file=extract-zip::ZIP not found at ${ZIP_PATH}"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create branch from main
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git checkout -b "${BRANCH_NAME}"

      - name: Extract ZIP contents
        run: |
          mkdir -p "${DEST_DIR}"
          unzip -o "${ZIP_PATH}" -d "${DEST_DIR}/"
          echo "Extraction done."

      - name: Detect large files (>100MB)
        run: |
          LARGE=$(find "${DEST_DIR}" -type f -size +100M -print || true)
          if [ -n "$LARGE" ]; then
            echo "##large_files##"
            echo "$LARGE"
            echo "::warning file=extract-zip::Large files detected. Consider Git LFS."
          else
            echo "No large files detected."
          fi

      - name: Commit changes
        run: |
          git add "${DEST_DIR}" || true
          if git diff --cached --quiet; then
            echo "No changes to commit."
          else
            git commit -m "Extract ${ZIP_PATH} into ${DEST_DIR}/"
            git push -u origin "${BRANCH_NAME}"
            echo "Pushed branch ${BRANCH_NAME}"
          fi

      - name: Output branch name
        run: echo "BRANCH=${BRANCH_NAME}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
```

C√≥mo usar el workflow:
- A√±ade el archivo en tu repo (por ejemplo, desde la UI o localmente y pushed).
- Ve a Actions ‚Üí Extract ZIP and commit contents ‚Üí Run workflow.
- Usar√°s el input zip_path si el ZIP est√° en otra ruta.
- La Action crear√° una rama, har√° commit y push. Abre PR desde la interfaz o usa gh CLI:
  - gh pr create --base main --head extract-zip-2026-02-05 --title "Extract ZIP..." --body "..."

Notas importantes (ambas opciones)
- Archivos >100 MB: GitHub bloquea push directo. Si detectas grandes, usa Git LFS:
  - git lfs install
  - git lfs track "*.bin" (o patrones espec√≠ficos)
  - git add .gitattributes
  - Re-commit los archivos grandes
- .gitignore: revisa para no subir node_modules/builds u otros artefactos.
- Si quieres que el .zip sea eliminado tras extracci√≥n, a√±ade un paso para git rm <zip> y commit.

QC / Compliance checklist (lo que revisar√© si ejecutas y me compartes PR/branch)
- No incluir node_modules/build/
- No subir credenciales/secretos
- Confirmar archivos grandes y proponer LFS si procede
- Confirmar estructura resultante en upload/

Qu√© har√© si me das la rama/PR o me das permiso program√°tico
- Si t√∫ prefieres crear la Action y ejecutarla, la Action har√° el trabajo y te dejar√° la rama con los cambios listos.
- Si me compartes el enlace de la rama o PR creado aqu√≠, puedo revisar el diff y darte el QC & notes.

Siguiente paso para ti (elige una)
- Opci√≥n A: Ejecutas el script local (extract-zip.sh). ¬øQuieres que te lo ejecute paso a paso por SSH? (no puedo conectarme, pero te gu√≠o).
- Opci√≥n B: Copias el workflow YAML a .github/workflows/extract-zip.yml y ejecutas la Action (recomendado si no quieres tocar local).
- Opci√≥n C: Si quieres que haga la operaci√≥n por ti a√∫n, agr√©game como colaborador con permisos write (entonces podr√© clonar y push) y me lo confirmas aqu√≠; puedo entonces crear la rama/PR.

Dime cu√°l opci√≥n eliges (A o B o C). Si eliges B y quieres, puedo darte el PR body exacto que se crear√° y el t√≠tulo y la descripci√≥n listos ‚Äî o puedo darte comandos gh para crear el PR desde tu m√°quina.

¬øProcedemos con la Action (B) y te doy los pasos exactos para a√±adirla y ejecutarla?

# Repository Code Search Guide

This ability provides comprehensive guidance for searching and navigating code in GitHub repositories. You have two powerful search tools available: **semantic-code-search** and **lexical-code-search**. Understanding when and how to use each is critical for effective code exploration.

## Available Search Tools

### semantic-code-search
**What it does:** Understands the meaning and context of your query to find conceptually relevant code.

**When to use:**
- User asks conceptual questions: "How does X work?", "Where is Y implemented?"
- Exploring unfamiliar codebases to understand architecture or features
- Finding code related to a specific functionality or concept
- No specific symbol names or file paths are known
- Need to understand patterns or approaches used in the codebase

**Key characteristics:**
- Query MUST be a complete sentence describing what you're looking for
- Returns code snippets ranked by semantic relevance
- Repository-scoped only (one repo at a time)

**Examples:**
| User question | Tool call |
|--------------|-----------|
| "How does authentication work in owner/repo?" | semantic-code-search: query="How does authentication work?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |
| "Where is rate limiting implemented?" | semantic-code-search: query="Where is rate limiting implemented?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |
| "How are database errors handled?" | semantic-code-search: query="How are database connection errors handled?", repoOwner="owner", repoName="repo" |

### lexical-code-search
**What it does:** Performs exact pattern matching using qualifiers to find specific code elements.

- User mentions specific symbols, functions, or class names

**Boolean operators:** Use OR, NOT, AND to combine conditions

3. Read the file to understand implementation details

### Example 2: Finding Specific Code

1. lexical-code-search: query="symbol:authenticate"

### Example 3: Debugging from Error Message

1. lexical-code-search: query="content:\"database connection timeout\""
   ‚Üí Finds where error message is defined
2. Read surrounding code for context

### Example 4: Exploring a Directory
User: "What helper utilities are in src/utils?"

1. lexical-code-search: query="path:/^src\\/utils\\/[^\\/]*helper[^\\/]*$/"
   ‚Üí Lists all files with "helper" in that directory

## Remember

Perfecto ‚Äî como est√°s en un iPad, la v√≠a m√°s r√°pida es a√±adir y ejecutar un GitHub Actions workflow desde la interfaz web. Te doy instrucciones claras paso a paso para crear el workflow (no necesitas terminal) y ejecutarlo. Cuando lo ejecutes, la Action crear√° una rama, extraer√° el ZIP en upload/ y har√° push; luego podr√°s abrir el PR desde la misma web.
```yaml name=.github/workflows/extract-zip.yml
name: Extract ZIP and commit contents

on:
```

```yaml name=.github/workflows/extract-zip.yml
name: Extract ZIP and commit contents

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      zip_path:
        description: 'Path to ZIP in the repo (relative)'
        required: true
        default: 'upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip'
      dest_dir:
        description: 'Destination directory'
        required: true
        default: 'upload'
      branch_name:
        description: 'Branch to create for the extraction'
        required: true
        default: 'extract-zip-2026-02-05'

jobs:
  extract-and-commit:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Ensure zip exists
        run: |
          if [ ! -f "${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" ]; then
            echo "::error file=extract-zip::ZIP not found at ${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create branch from main
        run: |
          BR="${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git checkout -b "${BR}"

      - name: Extract ZIP contents
        run: |
          mkdir -p "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}"
          unzip -o "${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" -d "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}/"
          echo "Extraction done."

      - name: Detect large files (>100MB)
        run: |

            echo "Large files detected:"

            echo "::warning file=extract-zip::Large files detected. Consider Git LFS or removing them before push."
          else
            echo "No large files detected."
          fi

      - name: Commit changes
        run: |
          git add "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}" || true
          if git diff --cached --quiet; then
            echo "No changes to commit."
          else
            git commit -m "Extract ${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }} into ${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}/"
            git push -u origin "${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
            echo "Pushed branch ${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
          fi
```

extract-zip.sh.name: extract-zip.sh
extract-zip.sh.value:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

REPO_SSH="git@github.com:pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS.git"
BRANCH="extract-zip-$(date +%F)"
ZIP_PATH="upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip"
DEST_DIR="upload"
GIT_COMMIT_MSG="Extract ${ZIP_PATH} into ${DEST_DIR}/"

# 1) Clona (si ya tienes el repo, salta esta parte y cd dentro)
if [ ! -d "PULSE_DEV_OS" ]; then
  git clone "${REPO_SSH}"
fi
cd PULSE_DEV_OS

# 2) Crea rama
git fetch origin
git checkout -b "${BRANCH}"

# 3) Asegurarse de que ZIP existe
if [ ! -f "${ZIP_PATH}" ]; then
  echo "ERROR: ${ZIP_PATH} not found. Adjust ZIP_PATH or ensure file exists in repo."
  exit 1
fi

# 4) Extraer en destino
mkdir -p "${DEST_DIR}"
unzip -o "${ZIP_PATH}" -d "${DEST_DIR}/"

# 5) Detectar archivos grandes (>100MB)
echo "Detectando archivos >100MB..."
LARGE_FILES=$(find "${DEST_DIR}" -type f -size +100M -print || true)
if [ -n "${LARGE_FILES}" ]; then
  echo "Archivos >100MB detectados:"
  echo "${LARGE_FILES}"
  echo "Si deseas usar Git LFS, instala y trackea antes de git add:"
  echo "  git lfs install"
  echo "  git lfs track \"*.ext\"   # ajustar patrones"
  echo "Revisar manualmente antes de continuar."
  # No abortamos autom√°ticamente, lo dejamos para revisi√≥n
fi

# 6) Preparar commit
git add "${DEST_DIR}"
git commit -m "${GIT_COMMIT_MSG}" || echo "No changes to commit."

# 7) Push y crear PR (usa gh CLI para crear PR)
git push -u origin "${BRANCH}"

echo "Branch pushed: ${BRANCH}"
echo "Crear PR con:"
echo "  gh pr create --base main --head ${BRANCH} --title \"${GIT_COMMIT_MSG}\" --body \"Extracted ZIP into ${DEST_DIR}/\""

extract-zip.ps1.name: extract-zip.ps1
extract-zip.ps1.value:
# 1) Clona el repo y crea una rama
git clone https://github.com/pulseagencysubscripciones-cmd/PULSE_DEV_OS.git
Set-Location PULSE_DEV_OS

# 2) Descomprime el zip en la carpeta upload/ (ajusta C:\ruta\archivo.zip)
Expand-Archive -Path "C:\ruta\archivo.zip" -DestinationPath .\upload\ -Force

# 3) Revisa cambios, a√±ade, commitea y push
git status
git add upload/
git commit -m "Extract archive.zip into upload/"
git push -u origin HEAD

.github/workflows/extract-zip.yml.name: .github/workflows/extract-zip.yml
.github/workflows/extract-zip.yml.value:
name: Extract ZIP and commit contents

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      zip_path:
        description: 'Path to ZIP in the repo (relative)'
        required: true
        default: 'upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip'
      dest_dir:
        description: 'Destination directory'
        required: true
        default: 'upload'
      branch_name:
        description: 'Branch to create for the extraction'
        required: true
        default: 'extract-zip-${{ github.event.client_payload.date }}'

jobs:
  extract-and-commit:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up variables
        run: |
          echo "ZIP_PATH=${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "DEST_DIR=${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          # branch param fallback
          if [ -z "${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}" ]; then
            echo "BRANCH_NAME=extract-zip-$(date +%F)" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          else
            BRANCH_NAME="${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
            # allow substituting date token
            BRANCH_NAME="${BRANCH_NAME//\$\{GITHUB_EVENT\}/}"
            echo "BRANCH_NAME=${BRANCH_NAME}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          fi
          echo "BRANCH_NAME=${BRANCH_NAME}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Ensure zip exists
        run: |
          if [ ! -f "${ZIP_PATH}" ]; then
            echo "::error file=extract-zip::ZIP not found at ${ZIP_PATH}"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create branch from main
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git checkout -b "${BRANCH_NAME}"

      - name: Extract ZIP contents
        run: |
          mkdir -p "${DEST_DIR}"
          unzip -o "${ZIP_PATH}" -d "${DEST_DIR}/"
          echo "Extraction done."

      - name: Detect large files (>100MB)
        run: |
          LARGE=$(find "${DEST_DIR}" -type f -size +100M -print || true)
          if [ -n "$LARGE" ]; then
            echo "##large_files##"
            echo "$LARGE"
            echo "::warning file=extract-zip::Large files detected. Consider Git LFS."
          else
            echo "No large files detected."
          fi

      - name: Commit changes
        run: |
          git add "${DEST_DIR}" || true
          if git diff --cached --quiet; then
            echo "No changes to commit."
          else
            git commit -m "Extract ${ZIP_PATH} into ${DEST_DIR}/"
            git push -u origin "${BRANCH_NAME}"
            echo "Pushed branch ${BRANCH_NAME}"
          fi

      - name: Output branch name
        run: echo "BRANCH=${BRANCH_NAME}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

name: Extract ZIP, commit contents and remove ZIP

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      zip_path:
        description: 'Path to ZIP in the repo (relative)'
        required: true
        default: 'upload/PROMPT_DEV_OS_v14_2_NODE_READY_ULTRA_HYBRID.zip'
      dest_dir:
        description: 'Destination directory'
        required: true
        default: 'upload'
      branch_name:
        description: 'Branch to create for the extraction'
        required: true
        default: 'extract-zip-2026-02-05'

jobs:
  extract-and-commit:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Ensure zip exists
        run: |
          if [ ! -f "${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" ]; then
            echo "::error file=extract-zip::ZIP not found at ${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create branch from main
        run: |
          BR="${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git checkout -b "${BR}"

      - name: Extract ZIP contents
        run: |
          mkdir -p "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}"
          unzip -o "${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" -d "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}/"
          echo "Extraction done."

      - name: Remove original ZIP
        run: |
          git rm -f "${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }}" || true
          echo "ZIP removed from index."

      - name: Detect large files (>100MB)
        run: |
          LARGE=$(find "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}" -type f -size +100M -print || true)
          if [ -n "$LARGE" ]; then
            echo "Large files detected:"
            echo "$LARGE"
            echo "::warning file=extract-zip::Large files detected. Consider Git LFS or removing them before push."
          else
            echo "No large files detected."
          fi

      - name: Commit changes
        run: |
          git add "${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}" || true
          if git diff --cached --quiet; then
            echo "No changes to commit."
          else
            git commit -m "Extract ${{ github.event.inputs.zip_path }} into ${{ github.event.inputs.dest_dir }}/ and remove original ZIP"
            git push -u origin "${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
            echo "Pushed branch ${{ github.event.inputs.branch_name }}"
          fi
